thread.title: Bank of America rises on profits; Delta soars on earnings beat
thread.title_full: Bank of America rises on profits; Delta soars on earnings beat - MarketWatch

author: By     Sue Chang
title: Bank of America rises on profits; Delta soars on earnings beat
text:
AFP/Getty Images Bank of America is on tap to report quarterly earnings. These are the shares likely to make notable moves in Wednesday trade:
Gainers Bank of America Corp. BAC, +0.65% rising 2.4% premarket after second-quarter earnings topped expectations .
BlackRock Inc. BLK, -0.44% also reported earnings ahead of forecasts , sending the shares 0.1% higher ahead of the bell.
Delta Air Lines Inc. DAL, +0.67% surged in premarket trade Wednesday after the air carrier posted second-quarter results that were better than Street estimates. Excluding nonrecurring items, earnings per share came in at $1.27, beating the FactSet consensus of $1.21. Revenue increased 1% to $10.71 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $10.65 billion.
Tickers to Watch Bank of America BAC, +0.65% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 36 cents a share, according to a consensus survey by FactSet. The financial firm reported earnings of 19 cents a share a year ago. The bank is among the stocks that Morgan Stanley is upbeat on ahead of its earnings report.
Intel INTC, -0.27% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of 50 cents a share, down from 55 cents a share a year ago.
A day after its 7-for-1 stock split, Netflix NFLX, -0.71% is expected to post second-quarter earnings of 28 cents a share versus $1.15 a share a year earlier.
U.S. Bancorp USB, +0.11% is projected to post second-quarter earnings of 80 cents a share, up from 78 cents a share a year earlier.
BlackRock Inc. BLK, -0.44% is expected to report second-quarter earnings of $4.80 a share, down from $4.89 a share a year earlier.
After Tuesday’s close, Yum Brands Inc. YUM, +0.97% reported second-quarter adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share on sales of $3.1 billion. Analysts had expected the parent company of Pizza Hut, KFC and Taco Bell to earn 63 cents a share on sales of $3.2 billion. Worldwide sales rose 3%, the company said.
Celgene Corp. CELG, +1.62% plans to buy Receptos Inc. RCPT, +5.11% for $7.2 billion as part of its effort to diversify its revenue source. Celgene also raised its 2015 earnings-per-share outlook to between $4.75 and $4.85 from a previous range of $4.60 to $4.75.
Mead Johnson Nutrition Co. MJN, -1.63% lowered its earnings outlook on slowing sales growth in China and other emerging markets. The baby-formula company now sees adjusted full-year earnings of $3.63 to $3.78 a share, down from its previous estimate of $3.90 to $4 a share.
Railroad company CSX Corp. CSX, +0.53% said its second-quarter profit rose to $533 million, or 56 cents a share, from $529 million, or 53 cents a share, a year ago. Revenue fell 6% to $3.06 billion, in part due to a 1% drop in freight volume. Operating income at the Dow Jones Transportation Average DJT, -0.07% component rose to $1.02 billion from $997 million a year ago.
Allegheny Technologies Inc. ATI, -2.05% said it expects to post a second-quarter loss of $16 million to $18 million, or 15 to 17 cents a share. Analysts had expected a profit of 21 cents a share, according to FactSet. Allegheny cited weak demand from energy markets and increased competition in its flat-rolled products segment.
After Wednesday’s close Intel INTC, -0.27% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of 50 cents a share, down from 55 cents a share a year ago.
Read: What to watch for in Intel’s earnings
A day after its 7-for-1 stock split, Netflix NFLX, -0.71% is expected to post second-quarter earnings of 28 cents a share versus $1.15 a share a year earlier.
Read: What to look for in Netflix’s earnings
